body_html:
Hi @wt-huang,

You can first try to save the model to a local directory with long file path.

With 'local NTFS partition mounted at C:' I mean a local directory. C: is in my case (as usual) the local partition where Windows is installed.

I tried it on a freshly installed virtual machine and it still fails with the same error message. New system information:

  • OS Platform and Distribution: Windows 10 Pro 64Bit (Version: 1803, Build: 17134.286)
  • TensorFlow installed from: binary
  • TensorFlow version: b'1.11.0-rc2-4-gc19e29306c' 1.11.0
  • Python version: 3.5.6

(I enabled the Enable Long File Path config and restarted the virtual machine)

With 'local NTFS partition mounted at C:' I mean a local directory. C: is in my case (as usual) the local partition where Windows is installed.
I tried it on a freshly installed virtual machine and it still fails with the same error message. New system information:

OS Platform and Distribution: Windows 10 Pro 64Bit (Version: 1803, Build: 17134.286)
TensorFlow installed from: binary
TensorFlow version: b'1.11.0-rc2-4-gc19e29306c' 1.11.0

body:
Hi @wt-huang,

> You can first try to save the model to a local directory with long file path.

With 'local NTFS partition mounted at `C:`' I mean a local directory. `C:` is in my case (as usual) the local partition where Windows is installed.

I tried it on a freshly installed virtual machine and it still fails with the same error message. New system information:
- **OS Platform and Distribution**: Windows 10 Pro 64Bit (Version: 1803, Build: 17134.286)
- **TensorFlow installed from**: binary
- **TensorFlow version**: b'1.11.0-rc2-4-gc19e29306c' 1.11.0
- **Python version**: 3.5.6

(I enabled the `Enable Long File Path` config and restarted the virtual machine)
